709c62b3-8918-41b9-a747-d21eb79c6c20.description: Policy Automation Composition Element for the Demo

version.description: Specifies the engine version in double dotted format

instance_count.description: Specifies the number of engine threads that should be run

deployment_port.description: Specifies the port to connect to for engine administration

policy_model_file_name.description: The name of the file from which to read the APEX policy model

policy_type_impl.description: The policy type implementation from which to read the APEX policy model

periodic_event_period.description: The time interval in milliseconds for the periodic scanning event, 0 means don't scan

engine.description: The parameters for all engines in the APEX engine service

name.description: Specifies the event handler name, if not specified this is set to the key name

carrier_technology.description: Specifies the carrier technology of the event handler (such as REST/Web Socket/Kafka)

event_protocol.description: Specifies the event protocol of events for the event handler (such as Yaml/JSON/XML/POJO)

event_name.description: Specifies the event name for events on this event handler, if not specified, the event name is read from or written to the event being received or sent

event_name_filter.description: Specifies a filter as a regular expression, events that do not match the filter are dropped, the default is to let all events through

synchronous_mode.description: Specifies the event handler is syncronous (receive event and send response)

synchronous_peer.description: The peer event handler (output for input or input for output) of this event handler in synchronous mode, this parameter is mandatory if the event handler is in synchronous mode

synchronous_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for responses to be issued by APEX torequests, this parameter is mandatory if the event handler is in synchronous mode

requestor_mode.description: Specifies the event handler is in requestor mode (send event and wait for response mode)

requestor_peer.description: The peer event handler (output for input or input for output) of this event handler in requestor mode, this parameter is mandatory if the event handler is in requestor mode

requestor_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for wait for responses to requests, this parameter is mandatory if the event handler is in requestor mode

label.description: The label (name) of the carrier technology (such as REST, Kafka, WebSocket)

plugin_parameter_class_name.description: The class name of the class that overrides default handling of event input or output for this carrier technology, defaults to the supplied input or output class

label.description: The label (name) of the event protocol (such as Yaml, JSON, XML, or POJO)

event_protocol_plugin_class.description: The class name of the class that overrides default handling of the event protocol for this carrier technology, defaults to the supplied event protocol class

name.description: The name of the environment variable

value.description: The value of the environment variable

context.description: The properties for handling context in APEX engines, defaults to using Java maps for context

executors.description: The plugins for policy executors used in engines such as javascript, MVEL, Jython

entry_schema.description: The plugin class path for this policy executor

distributor.description: The plugin to be used for distributing context between APEX PDPs at runtime

schemas.description: The plugins for context schemas available in APEX PDPs such as Java and Avro

locking.description: The plugin to be used for locking context in and between APEX PDPs at runtime

persistence.description: The plugin to be used for persisting context for APEX PDPs at runtime

name.description: The name of the executor such as Javascript, Jython or MVEL

plugin_class_name.description: The class path of the plugin class for this executor

onap.policies.Native.description: a base policy type for all native PDP policies
onap.policies.Native.name: onap.policies.Native

onap.policies.native.Apex.description: a policy type for native apex policies
onap.policies.native.Apex.name: onap.policies.native.Apex

inputs.description: Inputs for handling events coming into the APEX engine

outputs.description: Outputs for handling events going out of the APEX engine

environment.description: Envioronmental parameters for the APEX engine
